text: Fredrick Brathwaite (born November 24, 1972) is a Canadian retired professional ice hockey goaltender. He played parts of 9 years in the National Hockey League (NHL). He played for the Edmonton Oilers, Calgary Flames, St. Louis Blues and Columbus Blue Jackets. He also played for the Ak Bars Kazan of the Russian Superleague (RSL), as well as Avangard Omsk and Adler Mannheim of the Deutsche Eishockey Liga (DEL). Brathwaite was named Deutsche Eishockey Liga MVP in 2009. ==References== ==Other websites== * * Category:1972 births Category:Living people Category:Black Canadian sportspeople Category:Calgary Flames players Category:Canadian ice hockey goaltenders Category:Cape Breton Oilers players Category:Chicago Wolves players Category:Columbus Blue Jackets players Category:Edmonton Oilers players Category:Ice hockey people from Ottawa Category:Saint John Flames players Category:St. Louis Blues players Category:Syracuse Crunch players Category:International Hockey League (1945â€“2001) players Category:Ontario Hockey League players Category:Memorial Cup winners
title: Fred Brathwaite
